change my desktop wallpaper:
Changing the desktop wallpaper on macOS using System Preferences is a straightforward process. Here are the steps you need to follow:

1. **Open System Preferences**: Start by clicking on the Apple menu located at the top left corner of your screen. From the dropdown menu, select “System Preferences” [1][4].

2. **Access Desktop & Screen Saver**: In the System Preferences window, look for the option labeled “Desktop & Screen Saver” and click on it [1][8].

3. **Select Your Wallpaper**:
   - In the Desktop & Screen Saver settings, you will see a tab labeled "Desktop" where you can choose your wallpaper. You can select from Apple's default wallpaper options by navigating through the folders on the left side, such as "Desktop Pictures" or "Solid Colors" [3][10]. 
   - To use a personal image, you can drag and drop a photo from your Finder directly into the preview area or click the “Add Photo” button to select an image from your Photos library or any folder [11][12][15].

4. **Adjust Settings**: If you want your wallpaper to change at intervals, check the box next to “Change picture” and choose how frequently you want it to refresh [13].

5. **Close System Preferences**: Once you’ve selected your desired wallpaper, simply close the System Preferences window, and your changes will be saved automatically.

By following these steps, you can easily customize the look of your desktop to better suit your personal style or mood.
